</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.Finite.Nondegenerate | 1459 | 1463 | +4 (+0.27%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.RootSystem`|3|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.Basic` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.RootSystem.Finite.Nondegenerate`|4|

</details>

</details>

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsBalanced`
`+ IsCrystallographic.mem_range_algebraMap`

`+ instance : P.IsBalanced`
`+ instance {Î¹ R M N : Type*} [AddCommGroup M] [AddCommGroup N]`
`+ ker_corootForm_eq_dualAnnihilator`
`+ ker_rootForm_eq_dualAnnihilator`
`+ left_top_iff`
`+ restrictScalars`
`+ restrictScalars'`
`+ restrictScalarsRat`
`+ restrictScalars_coe_coroot`
`+ restrictScalars_coe_root`
`+ restrictScalars_pairing`
`+ restrictScalars_toPerfectPairing_apply_apply`
`+ right_top_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20442~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12861292833/job/35854460432)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12861292833/job/35854460308)
I think you can use `induction hx, hy using span_induction2` or similar here.
These lemmas are remnants from an earlier (messier) implementation. They seem just about worth keeping but I'd be happy to drop them if others aren't convinced.

I have been toying with introducing:
```lean
structure IsAnnCompl (U : Submodule R M) (V : Submodule R N) : Prop where
  left : IsCompl U (V.dualAnnihilator.map p.toDualLeft.symm)
  right : IsCompl V (U.dualAnnihilator.map p.toDualRight.symm)
```
to express this since it has now come up a few times.
Yeah, that seems reasonable to me.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: restriction of scalars for root pairings with coefficients in a field
